page.title: 17THE FOREST ROW COUNTRY WALK
page.content: After the Beeching rail-cuts the East Grinstead to Tunbridge Wells line was converted into a nature walk.On 11:6:85 we walked 1 mile of this track to study the nature there.We identified the following trees:Sweet Chestnut, Oak, Ash, Willow, Birch, Hazel, Pine, Fir tree, Silver Birch. The most common was the Ash tree. We identified the following shrubs and flowers: primrose, violet, gorse, bluebell, buttercups, thistles, fern, fox-glove, dog-rose bush, Blackthorn, Whitethorn, nettles, ivy bush and dock leaf. The major problem of the path is erosion. Motorbikes, bycycles and horses are damaging the path.In places a second path has developed and the original path has doubled in width.
